text:
A message from Pao Corrales about a Code of Conduct book club that looks useful for anyone interested in supporting online or in-person communities, meetings and conferences etc:

>  I'm writing to you this time as a part of the RLadies Global Team. We are organising a book club to read <https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fframeshiftconsulting.com%2Fresources%2Fcode-of-conduct-book%2F&data=05%7C02%7CH.Turner.1%40warwick.ac.uk%7C5517102a04ed4656992608dcd54bcb04%7C09bacfbd47ef446592653546f2eaf6bc%7C0%7C0%7C638619768748182048%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=4lLgic3nnQyzBKR0IEbSY5CYEsjGU6qaydrsCXr8mmE%3D&reserved=0|How to Respond to Code of Conduct Reports written by Valerie Aurora and Mary Gardiner and edited by Annalee Flower Horne>. The idea is to have open discussions about how to respond to a CoC issue and in general revise the processes/structure we have and what we are missing. 
> 
> The activity is open to chapter organisers and the global team but we are inviting other community organisers to bring different perspectives and experience. I like to extend the invitation to you and organisers/members of RForwards and RContributors that would benefit from participating. 
> 
> The book club will be organised in 6 online sessions every 2 weeks, starting in October. If you are interested in participating, please complete the following by September 25th:
> • Complete this when2meet so we can choose the best day and time for the first session. Note: the following session will be scheduled at the same time every 2 weeks. <https://www.when2meet.com/?26404144-VGm4Y>
> • Complete this form to show interest and get the calendar invite. <https://airtable.com/app6Y5lBGctHcU3lI/pagNygyJrSSiEy6d6/form>

elements.text: A message from Pao Corrales about a Code of Conduct book club that looks useful for anyone interested in supporting online or in-person communities, meetings and conferences etc:
I'm writing to you this time as a part of the RLadies Global Team. We are organising a book club to read
How to Respond to Code of Conduct Reports written by Valerie Aurora and Mary Gardiner and edited by Annalee Flower Horne

. The idea is to have open discussions about how to respond to a CoC issue and in general revise the processes/structure we have and what we are missing. 

The activity is open to chapter organisers and the global team but we are inviting other community organisers to bring different perspectives and experience. I like to extend the invitation to you and organisers/members of RForwards and RContributors that would benefit from participating. 

The book club will be organised in 6 online sessions every 2 weeks, starting in October. If you are interested in participating, please complete the following by September 25th:
Complete this when2meet so we can choose the best day and time for the first session. Note: the following session will be scheduled at the same time every 2 weeks.
Complete this form to show interest and get the calendar invite.
